column2: in prōtectiōne Deī caelī commorābitur.^He that dwelleth in the aid of the most High
column3: shall abide under the protection of the God of Jacob.
spērābō in eum.^He shall say to the Lord: Thou art my protector

column1: 3^Quoniam ipse līberāvit mē dē laqueō vēnantium
column2: et ā verbō asperō.^For he hath delivered me from the snare of the hunters
et sub pennīs ejus spērābis.^He will overshadow thee with his shoulders
column3: and under his wings thou shalt trust.

column1: 5^Scūtō circumdabit tē vēritās ejus; nōn timēbis ā timōre nocturnō
column2: ^His truth shall compass thee with a shield; thou shalt not be afraid of the terror of the night

column4: et daemoniō merīdiānō.^of the arrow that flieth in the day
column5: of the business that walketh about in the dark

column2: et decem mīllia ā dextrīs tuīs
column3: ad tē autem nōn adpropinquābit.^A thousand shall fall at thy side
column4: and ten thousand at thy right hand
column5: but it shall not come nigh thee.

column2: et retribūtiōnem peccātōrum vidēbis.^But thou shalt consider with thy eyes
column3: and shalt see the reward of the wicked.
spēs mea; Altissimum posuistī refugium tuum.^Because thou
column5: art my hope; thou hast made the most High thy refuge.

column2: et flagellum nōn adpropinquābit tabernāculō tuō;^There shall no evil come to thee
column3: nor shall the scourge come near thy dwelling;

column2: ut cūstōdiant tē in omnibus viīs tuīs.^for he hath given his angels charge over thee
column3: to keep thee in all thy ways.

column2: nē forte offendās ad lapidem pedem tuum.^In their hands they shall bear thee up
column3: lest thou dash thy foot against a stone.

column2: et conculcābis leōnem et dracōnem.^Thou shalt walk upon the asp and the basilisk
column3: and thou shalt trample under foot the lion and the dragon.
quoniam cognōvit nōmen meum.^Because he hoped in me
column4: I will deliver him; I will protect him because he hath known my name.

column2: et ego exaudiam eum; cum ipsō sum in trībulātiōne; ēripiam eum et glōrificābō eum.^He shall cry to me
column3: and I will hear him; I am with him in tribulation; I will deliver him and I will glorify him.

column2: et ostendam illī salūtāre meum.^I will fill him with length of days
column3: and I will show him my salvation.
